p: To identify potential drivers of disease pathology, we focused our attention on modules significantly correlated with AsymAD cases, representing the earliest disease phase. This highlighted module C1 ( Figures 3A– 3G and S1B– S1Q; Table S4) and the C8 and C10 modules, which were upregulated in AsymAD and AD cases ( Figures 3H– 3W and S2; Table S4). C1 represented genes highly expressed in neurons (hypergeometric test; p = 1.0e–23) and was enriched for synaptic processes, consistent with pre- and post-synaptic vesicle hub proteins such as HOMER1, DLG4, and SYT1 ( Figure 3A). The hub gene SYT1, which mediates synaptic vesicle release, is reduced in human AD brain and has been shown to promote Aβ generation ( Gautam et al., 2015; Öhrfelt et al., 2016; Yoo et al., 2001).
